name: The Life of Bruce Willis Quiz | Celebrities | 15 Questions

questions.explanation:
March 19, 1955.

	He was born on a military base in West Germany to David and Marlene Willis.

questions.text: What is the birth name of Bruce Willis?
questions.explanation:
Walter Bruce Willis.

	Has used his middle name since he was a child.

questions.text: What town in New Jersey did Bruce grow up in and graduate high school?
questions.explanation:
PennsGrove.

	Following his graduation he moved to New York and worked as a bartender and waited tables until he was discovered by a casting director.

questions.text: Which of the following films did Bruce NOT star in?
questions.explanation:
The One.

	"The Whole Nine Yards" was the 6th film Bruce has starred in with numbers in the title. They are: "The First Deadly Sin" (1980); "12 Monkeys" (1995); "Four Rooms" (1995); "The Fifth Element" (1997); "The Sixth Sense" (1999); and "The Whole Nine Yards" (2000).

questions.text: Which of the following popular films did Bruce Willis have a starring role in but dropped out?
questions.explanation:
Ocean's Eleven.

	He was set to play the role of Terry Benedict, however the role ended up being played by Andy Garcia.

questions.text: The first "Die Hard" movie that Bruce starred in was released in 1987?
Bruce had a role in which of the following television series in the 1980s?
questions.explanation:
Miami Vice.

	He played Tony Amato in the episode entitled "No Exit" on November 9th, 1984.

questions.text: How many children did Bruce Willis have with his ex-wife Demi Moore?
questions.explanation:
3.

	He has three daughters with ex-wife Demi Moore.  Rumer, Scout, and Tallulah.  His eldest daughter Rumer played Demi's daughter Angela in "Striptease" (1996).

questions.text: Bill Capa was the character played by Bruce in which film?
questions.explanation:
The Color of Night.

	This 1994 mystery thriller was a box office bomb.  It is one of the funniest movies without even trying to be.  Bruce stars as a psychiatrist who witnesses a patient's suicide and then becomes unable to see the color red.  Bruce experienced his first full frontal scenes in this film as well.  It also starred Ruben Blades, Lesley Ann Warren, Lance Henriksen, and Jane March.

questions.text: What was Bruce's character's name in the 1993 film "Striking Distance"?
questions.explanation:
Tom Hardy.

	Korben Dallas was his character in "The Fifth Element" (1997); Butch Coolidge was his character in "Pulp Fiction" (1994); and Harry S. Stamper was his character in "Armageddon" (1998).

questions.text: Bruce won an Emmy for Outstanding Leading Actor in a Drama Series for his portrayal of David Addison on "Moonlighting" in which year?
questions.explanation:
1987.

	He was nominated in 1986 but did not win.  He won his second Emmy in 2000 for a guest appearance on "Friends".

questions.text: Bruce's brother David died of pancreatic cancer in 2001?
questions.explanation:
False.

	His brother that died of cancer was Robert and he was 42.  Bruce also has a sister named Flo.

questions.text: Which of the following films has Bruce worked on with M. Night Shyamalan?
questions.explanation:
The Sixth Sense and Unbreakable.

	Bruce has been directed by M. Night Shyamalan in "The Sixth Sense" (1999) and "Unbreakable" (2000).

questions.text: Bruce was credited for writing the 1991 film "Hudson Hawk"?
questions.explanation:
True.

	Bruce Willis and Robert Kraft received story credits for this 1991 box office flop.

questions.text: What is the name of the actress that Bruce was married to from 1987 to 2000?
questions.explanation:
Demi Moore & Moore & Demi.

	Bruce and Demi were married from November 21, 1987 to October 18, 2000.  They officially split in June of 1998 but their divorce was not final until 2000.  They remain such good friends that in 2002 Bruce bought a home across the street from Moore and their three daughters in Idaho.
